name: Base metals
description: Abundant in the Earth's crust, most of them are commonly used in industry. Some of them can require large amounts of energy during extraction and refining
examples: Aluminum (Al), Copper (Cu), Nickel (Ni), Tin (Sn), Iron (Fe), Zinc (Zn), Magnesium (Mg), Manganese (Mn)

name: Precious metals
description: Rare but above all of great economic value, they are mainly used in printed circuit boards

name: Rare earths
description: Rare earths, not to be confused with rare metals, are called rare not so much because of their actual scarcity but because they are difficult to extract

name: Other metals
description: This category mainly includes 'speciality metals', i.e. all other metals that are quite rare or scarce, but whose current economic value is not enough to make them precious
examples: Lithium (Li), Cobalt (Co), Tantalum (Ta), Indium (In), Antimony (Sb), Tungsten (W), Gallium (Ga), Germanium (Ge), Silicon (Si)
